panels.description: Current number of nodes in a non-ready state across the entire cluster. Prolonged node outages can disrupt functionality if not handled quickly. Review the health of your nodes to get them back in a ready state.
panels.title: Healthy Nodes

panels.description: Current number of nodes in a non-ready state across the entire cluster. Prolonged node outages can disrupt functionality if not handled quickly. Review the health of your nodes to get them back in a ready state.
panels.title: Unhealthy Nodes

panels.description: This panel shows the CPU utilization across the entire cluster. Consistently high CPU usage will lead to slower processing, ensure CPU is allocated appropriately.
panels.title: Cluster

panels.description: This panel shows the memory utilization across the entire cluster. Consistently high memory usage can lead to pods getting killed, potentially resulting in loss of functionality. Ensure allocated memory is sufficient to avoid this.
panels.title: Cluster

panels.description: Number of PVCs that have exceeded 50% of their allocated storage within the selected namespace . PVCs approaching/exceeding 100% will cause pod failures, leading to loss of functionality. To view more PVC details, refer to the Health dashboard under the "Storage Health" section.
panels.title: Exceeding 50%

panels.description: Number of PVCs that have exceeded 80% of their allocated storage within the selected namespace . PVCs approaching/exceeding 100% will cause pod failures, leading to loss of functionality. To view more PVC details, refer to the Health dashboard under the "Storage Health" section.
panels.title: Exceeding 80%

panels.description:
Refer to the "Event Processing dashboard" -> "Policy Automation Dependencies" for further details.

Count that tracks the number of pods that were newly created within the time range.

New pods indicate restarts may have occurred which could result in loss of functionality. Review the pod uptime time graph to see if any gaps in uptime occurred.

New pods don't always indicate a problem and in some cases are part of routine processing and scaling.

0.text: pods are stable - no new pods within time range

result.text: pods not stable  - review uptime graph for gaps

defaults.noValue: pods are stable - no new pods within time range

targets.expr: sum(((sum((time() - kube_pod_start_time{pod=~".*-topology-.*", pod!~".*cassandra.*", pod!~".*file-observer.*", pod!~".*kubernetes-observer.*", pod!~".*observer.*",pod!~".*api.*", pod!~".*aiopsedge.*", pod!~".*job.*", pod!~".*schema.*"}) - $__range_s) by (pod)) < 60) <= bool 0)

panels.title: Topology Component

Refer to the "Web UI" dashboard for further details.

panels.title: Web UI Component Stability

panels.description:
Refer to the "Event Integrations" dashboard -> "Webhook integration" for further details.

Count of  exceptions, and status failures that occurred within the Webhook integration.
panels.title: Webhook Errors

panels.description:
Refer to the "Analytics" dashboard for further details.

Count of event classification errors.

defaults.noValue: All queries successful within time range

panels.title: Event Classification Errors

panels.description:
Refer to the "Event Processing" dashboard -> "Datalayer Component" for further details.

Total failure count for alert expire/close/delete actions executed by the Job Manager service that occurred within the time range.

- **Alert expire**: occurs when an alert's expiration team has been reached
- **Alert close**: occurs when alert expires or is closed by an event or triggered by manual user action in the UI
- **Alert delete**: occurs after an alert has been closed for a period of time. This will delete it from the database

targets.expr:
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_ircore_ncodl_jobmgr_job_alert_delete_counter{container="jobmgr", kind="failed"}[$__range]) or vector(0)) + 
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_ircore_ncodl_jobmgr_job_alert_close_counter{container="jobmgr", kind="failed"}[$__range]) or vector(0)) + 
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_ircore_ncodl_jobmgr_job_alert_expire_counter{container="jobmgr", kind="failed"}[$__range]) or vector(0))

panels.title: Alert Request Errors

panels.description:
Refer to the "Event Processing" dashboard -> "Datalayer Component" for further details.

Total failure count for incident close/delete actions executed by the Job Manager service that occurred within the time range.

targets.expr: sum(increase(ibm_aiops_ircore_ncodl_jobmgr_job_story_close_counter{container="jobmgr", kind="failed"}[$__range]) or vector(0)) + sum(increase(ibm_aiops_ircore_ncodl_jobmgr_job_story_delete_counter{container="jobmgr", kind="failed"}[$__range]) or vector(0))

panels.title: Incident Request Errors

panels.description:
Refer to the "Event Integrations" dashboard -> "Instana integration" for further details.

Count of dropped kafka messages, exceptions, and status failures that occurred within the Instana integration.

targets.expr:
round(
  sum(increase(connectors_sdk_connectorexceptions_thrown_total{pod=~".*-instana-.*"}[$__range]) or vector(0)) + 
  sum(increase(connector_sdk_status_failed_total{pod=~".*-instana-.*"}[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
  sum(increase(connector_sdk_kafka_consumer_dropped_total{pod=~".*-instana-.*"}[$__range]) or vector(0))
)

panels.title: Instana Errors

panels.description:
Refer to the "Event Integrations" dashboard -> "Netcool integration" for further details.

Count of dropped kafka messages, exceptions, and status failures that occurred within the Netcool integration.

targets.expr:
round(
  sum(increase(connectors_sdk_connectorexceptions_thrown_total{pod=~"netcool-conn-.*"}[$__range]) or vector(0)) + 
  sum(increase(connector_sdk_status_failed_total{pod=~"netcool-conn-.*"}[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
  sum(increase(connector_sdk_kafka_consumer_dropped_total{pod=~".*-instana-.*"}[$__range]) or vector(0))
) or vector(0)

panels.title: Netcool Errors

panels.description:
Refer to the "Analytics" dashboard for further details.

Count of AI training errors.
panels.title: Training Errors

panels.description:
Refer to the "Event Processing" dashboard -> "RBA Component" for further details.

Count of Actions that failed to start or completed unsuccessfully.
panels.title: Action Errors

panels.description:
Refer to the "Event Processing" dashboard -> "RBA Component" for further details.

Count of runbook executions that failed to start or completed unsuccessfully

targets.expr:
round(
  sum(increase(ibm_aiops_rba_rbs_runbooks_start_failed[$__range]) or vector(0))+
  sum(increase(ibm_aiops_rba_rbs_runbooks_finished{status="unsuccessful"}[$__range]) or vector(0))
) or vector(0)

panels.title: Runbook Errors

panels.description:
Refer to the "Topology" dashboard for further details.

Count of database query failures made by the Topology Services within the time range

targets.expr:
round(
  sum(increase(ibm_aiops_topo_janusgraph_query_graph_exceptions{service="aiops-topology-merge"}[$__range]) or vector(0)) + 
  sum(increase(ibm_aiops_topo_janusgraph_query_graph_exceptions{service="aiops-topology-status"}[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
  sum(increase(ibm_aiops_topo_janusgraph_query_graph_exceptions{service="aiops-topology-layout"}[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
  sum(increase(ibm_aiops_topo_janusgraph_query_graph_exceptions{service="aiops-topology-topology"}[$__range]) or vector(0))
)

panels.title: Topology Database Query Errors

panels.description:
Refer to the "Web UI" dashboard for further details.

Count of 400 errors that occurred within the time range.

targets.expr:
round(
  sum(increase(ibm_aiops_aiops_akora_ui_request_total{code=~"4.."}[$__range]) or vector(0)) + 
  sum(increase(ibm_aiops_aiops_base_ui_request_total{code=~"4.."}[$__range]) or vector(0)) + 
  sum(increase(ibm_aiops_aiops_integration_ui_request_total{code=~"4.."}[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
  sum(increase(ibm_aiops_aiops_ai_models_ui_request_total{code=~"4.."}[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
  sum(increase(ibm_aiops_aiops_insights_ui_request_total{code=~"4.."}[$__range]) or vector(0))
)

panels.title: 400 Errors

panels.description:
Refer to the "Web UI" dashboard for further details.

Count of 500 errors that occurred within the time range.

targets.expr:
round(
  sum(increase(ibm_aiops_aiops_akora_ui_request_total{code=~"5.."}[$__range]) or vector(0)) + 
  sum(increase(ibm_aiops_aiops_base_ui_request_total{code=~"5.."}[$__range]) or vector(0)) + 
  sum(increase(ibm_aiops_aiops_integration_ui_request_total{code=~"5.."}[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
  sum(increase(ibm_aiops_aiops_ai_models_ui_request_total{code=~"5.."}[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
  sum(increase(ibm_aiops_aiops_insights_ui_request_total{code=~"5.."}[$__range]) or vector(0))
)

targets.expr:
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_logconnector_custom_live_logs_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_logconnector_custom_historical_logs_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_logconnector_elk_live_logs_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_logconnector_elk_historical_logs_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_logconnector_logscale_live_logs_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_logconnector_logscale_historical_logs_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_logconnector_mezmo_live_logs_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_logconnector_mezmo_historical_logs_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_logconnector_splunk_live_logs_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_logconnector_splunk_historical_logs_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0))

panels.title: Logs collected
